The most effective way to assure patient adherence to medication regimen is to have the patient repeat the medication name, dosage, and frequency back to the physician. This allows the physician to ensure that the patient understands the instructions and can follow them correctly. Providing a print-out or having the patient write the information on a calendar at home may be helpful, but does not guarantee that the patient fully comprehends the medication regimen. Contacting the pharmacist may also be helpful, but does not involve the patient directly in the process.
